topics.body:
This is just a bit of rumor mill, but I noticed something interesting: for those of you that know what Kantai Collection is before the anime started there was a massive amount of hype for it. . and then it came out and it turned out they removed the romance angle and made it a mediocre action anime with a boring main character that nobody liked.  If you're one of those "woohoo!  Make everything a shonen cause it makes it instantly better!" this is a prime example of why removing the core aspect of a franchise to appeal to the lowest common denominator is a bad idea.  They removed everything people liked about Kantai and made the main character completely boring as fuck to appease to everyone and as a result it was a fucking trainwreck.

Meanwhile the exact instant Kantai started losing popularity Monster Musume's popularity started spiking. . literally the exact same time.



Tl:dr; "Hey everybody!  Anime fans do you like Kantai Collection?!" "Hells yeah!" "Well good news everyone!  We're going to make a anime where the main character is unlikable and time wise bench every likable character into merely background characters and instead replace them with the B-team that nobody cares about!'
*cricket chirps*
"Hey anime fans!  Do you like harem anime?  Well here comes Monster Musume!"
*fans cheering*

Tl:dr; benching every likable character and replacing them with characters nobody cares about when making a anime is a bad idea.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
